lines.text: I'm an old man, and I've had many troubles. And most of them never happened.
And when they bury me, they can put on the gravestone, 'This was a big waste of time.'
Listen, sonny boy. Love, no matter how shabby it may seem, is still a beautiful thing. Everything else is nothing.

[Talking to Betty]
I can't tell you how often recently I've found myself thinking about dying. "Dying" to you is something that happens to old relatives, but it's a very intimate business to me. I don't expect you to understand this, but in those moments when I'm suddenly impossible to live with, that's probably what's at the bottom of my bad temper.
I haven't had ten cent's worth of life! Not a dime! Believe me!

43]
I love you, Jerry. I need you. I don't know what to do without you.

45]
That's a lousy kind of love.

47]
Well, it's the only kind of love I know. I'd be a good wife to you, Jerry. I promise you that.
